titleStmt.title: The grounds of the lawes of England; extracted from the fountaines of all other learning: and digested methodically into cases, for the use and benefit of all practicers, and students. With a commixtion of divers scattered grounds concerning the reasonable construction of the law. / By M.H. of the Middle-Temple.
titleStmt.author: Hawke, Michael.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for H. Twyford, T. Dring, Jo. Place, and W. Place, and are to be sold at their shops in Vine-Court Middle-Temple, at the George in Fleetstreet, at Furnivals, and Grayes-Inne Gates in Holborn,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: their shops in Vine-Court Middle-Temple, at the George in Fleetstreet, at Furnivals
